title: Cattle Ranch Casserole
description: This cattle ranch casserole is a beefy, cheesy, tomato and chile-rich casserole with a biscuit base. It's perfectly suitable for a family or for a group of hungry ranch hands.
ingredients: 2 cups baking mix, such as Bisquick
1/2 cup sour cream, plus more for garnish
2 cups shredded pepper Jack cheese, divided
1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with Hatch green chiles, drained
1/2 cup chopped cilantro or green onions for garnish
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Lightly coat a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
Stir baking mix, milk, and 1 tablespoon oil together in a bowl. Spread evenly in the prepared baking dish.

Bake in the preheated oven until just starting to turn golden brown, 10 to 15 minutes. This step is just par-baking - this layer will not be fully baked at this point. Remove from the oven and set aside.
Heat remaining tablespoon oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add ground beef and cook, stirring occasionally, until almost cooked through, about 4 minutes.

Add onion and poblano, stirring occasionally, until the beef is cooked through and onions begin to soften, about 4 minutes more. Stir in taco seasoning and salt until evenly combined. Remove from heat; set aside.
Add mayonnaise, sour cream, 1 cup pepper Jack cheese, and 1 cup Cheddar cheese to a bowl; stir until well combined.

Spoon beef mixture evenly over par-baked biscuit in the baking dish. Sprinkle drained diced tomatoes evenly over beef. Carefully spoon mayonnaise mixture over beef and tomatoes. Sprinkle evenly with remaining shredded cheese.
Bake, uncovered, until cheese is bubbly and starting to turn golden brown, about 30 minutes.
Let the dish rest for 10 minutes before serving. Garnish with sour cream and cilantro or green onions.
tips: Let the dish rest for 10 minutes before serving to allow the flavors to meld together.

structured_content.content: This cattle ranch casserole is a beefy, cheesy, tomato and chile-rich casserole with a biscuit base. It's perfectly suitable for a family or for a group of hungry ranch hands.

note.label: What Makes This Recipe Special
note.content:
• Rich in flavor
  • Hearty and filling
  • Perfect for a large group

structured_content.content: This recipe was a hit at our last family gathering. Everyone loved the combination of flavors and the cheesy topping.

• Baking mix: This forms the base of the casserole
  • Ground beef: The main protein in this dish

Preparation:
Preheat the oven and prepare the baking dish. Mix the baking mix, milk, and oil and spread in the dish. Par-bake the base.
Cooking:
Cook the beef and vegetables, then layer the ingredients in the dish and bake until golden brown.

upload.context: A delicious, hearty casserole fresh from the oven.

note.label: Things to Keep in Mind
note.content:
• Be sure to let the dish rest before serving
  • Feel free to adjust the amount of cheese to your liking

structured_content.content: This casserole is a favorite at our family gatherings. It's always the first dish to disappear!
Add extra taco seasoning or a dash of hot sauce for a spicy kick.
Serve with a side of fresh salad and a dollop of sour cream.
Try using different types of cheese or adding some cooked bacon for a different flavor profile.

note.label: Chef's Suggestions
note.content:
• Use fresh ingredients for the best flavor
  • Don't rush the baking process - let the cheese get nice and golden

structured_content.content: Enjoy this hearty and delicious casserole with your loved ones. Happy cooking!
